page.title: 14RAILWAY EMBANKMENT : HULL
page.content: The track on many sections of the old Hull and Barnsley line were removed many years ago but the embankment now provides a home for many animals and plants. On a walk near the old power station down Sculcoates Lane, we found many young sycamore trees growing here. Bracket fungi had sprouted here and there and a pile of chicken bones and feathers suggested a family of foxes lived nearby. Many wild plants including sorrel, yarrow, rosebay, ragwort and red clover grow in abundance. Among them we found red admiral butterflies, grasshoppers and an array of other insects. Overhead a kestrel hung, keeping a sharp look-out for mice and voles. Suddenly a young rabbit shot out from its burrow, disturbing a flock of goldfinches feeding in the thistles.
